m_szDocTitle: First 3D Printed Car Built, Driven at Chicago Trade Show
m_szDocSumamry: First 3D Printed Car Built, Driven at Chicago Trade Show By Nick Sanchez   |   Wednesday, 17 Sep 2014 07:07 AM Close       A   A    The first 3D printed car was built Saturday at the International Manufacturing Technology Show in Chicago and then taken for a spin. Named Strati — Italian for "layers" — the electric car was printed out of carbon fiber plastic over the course of 44 hours right on the show floor at McCormick Place by Cincinnati Incorporated. "Less than 50 parts are in this car," Jay Rogers, CEO of Local Motors, told KFOR-TV . Local Motors is based in Market Square, Tennessee, and
